title: Mount Cameroon FC
text:
Mount Cameroon Football Club is a <a href="Cameroon">Cameroon</a>ian <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> club based in <a href="Bu%C3%A9a">Buéa</a>. The club was founded in 1997 by Hon. Calvin Foinding. They have competed for more than 12 years in the <a href="Cameroon%20Premi%C3%A8re%20Division">Cameroon Première Division</a> (Elite One). Their home stadium is the 3,200 seat <a href="Molyko%20Omnisport%20Stadium">Molyko Omnisport Stadium</a> but Mount Cameroon FC also plays its home matches on its own academy "Stade d'Honneur" field.
Mount Cameroon FC took football in the region to the pinnacle in 2002 when they became the first club in the region and second West of the Mungo to lift the .
Notable players.
Mount Cameroon FC have served as a springboard for several youth players who have gone on to have successful professional careers. Notable players who started their careers at MCFC include <a href="Eyong%20Enoh">Eyong Enoh</a>, <a href="Charley%20Roussel%20Fomen">Charley Roussel Fomen</a>, <a href="Valentine%20Atem">Valentine Atem</a>, Donald Djousse and Elvis Mokake.
